{{Infobox film |name = Finding Dawn |image = Finding Dawn (DVD cover).jpg |image_size = |caption = |producer = |director = [[Christine Welsh]] |writer = |starring = |distributor = National Film Board of Canada
[[Women Make Movies]] |cinematography = |editing = |studio = [[National Film Board of Canada]] |released = 2006 |runtime = 73 minutes |country = Canada |language = English |imdb = }} '''''Finding Dawn''''' is a 2006 [[documentary film]] by [[Métis people (Canada)|Métis]] filmmaker [[Christine Welsh]] looking into the fate of an estimated 500 [[Aboriginal peoples in Canada|Canadian Aboriginal]] women who have been [[Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women|murdered or have gone missing]] over the past 30 years. ==Subject== The film begins with the story of Dawn Crey: one of 60 women, a third of them Aboriginal, who have disappeared from [[Vancouver]]'s [[Downtown Eastside]] over a 20-year period. Crey's remains were among those found on the property of British Columbia serial killer [[Robert Pickton]].{{cite journal|last=O'CONNOR |first=JENNIFER|date=Winter 2009 |title=FINDING DAWN|journal=Herizons|publisher=Bnet|url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_7554/is_200901/ai_n32313401/?tag=content;col1}}{{cite news|url=https://www.straight.com/article/metis-filmmaker-christine-welsh-can-be-proud-of-her-showing-at-the-amnesty-international-film-festival|title=Métis filmmaker Christine Welsh can be proud of her showing at the Amnesty International Film Festival|date=November 9, 2006|work=[[Georgia Straight]]|accessdate=26 November 2009}} However, not enough of Dawn's DNA was found to list her as one of the murder victims at the trial. The film introduces viewers to Dawn sister and brother, and their involvement in the annual [[Women’s Memorial March]] in Vancouver.{{cite journal|last=de Vos|first=Gail |date=January 11, 2008 |title=FINDING DAWN|journal=Canadian Materials|publisher=Manitoba Library Association|volume= XIV |issue= 10|url=http://www.umanitoba.ca/outreach/cm/vol14/no10/findingdawn.html}} The film then focuses on BC's Highway 16, known as the [[Highway of Tears murders|Highway of Tears]], which runs between [[Prince Rupert, British Columbia]] and [[Prince George, British Columbia]], looking at the fate of Ramona Wilson. Wilson was one of nine women – all but one of them Native – who have gone missing or been murdered on that stretch of road since the 1990s. Welsh also filmed in [[Saskatoon]], where a woman named Daleen Kay Bosse disappeared in 2004. She went missing in May but a criminal investigation didn't begin until the following January. In the film, Daleen’s parents and friends talk about their difficulty in getting Saskatoon police to take Daleen’s disappearance seriously. Native rights activists [[Janice Acoose]] and [[Fay Blaney]] are interviewed in the film. Christine Welsh has produced, written and directed films for more than 30 years. She is an associate professor at the [[University of Victoria]], where she teaches courses in indigenous women’s studies and [[indigenous cinema]].{{cite web|url=http://csws.uoregon.edu/?p=1097 |title=Acclaimed Feminist Filmmaker To Screen "Finding Dawn" |last= |first= |date= |publisher=[[University of Oregon]] |work=[[Center for the Study of Women in Society]] |accessdate=26 November 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090508140428/http://csws.uoregon.edu/?p=1097 |archivedate=8 May 2009 |df= }} ==Impact== ''Finding Dawn'' is referenced in the later 2015 documentary ''[[Highway of Tears (film)|Highway of Tears]]'', which notes its impact on native viewers.{{cite AV media|title=[[Highway of Tears (film)|Highway of Tears]]| author1=Matthew Smiley (Director) | date=March 6, 2015 | medium=Motion picture }} ==See also== *[[Wendy Poole Park]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.nfb.ca/film/finding_dawn Watch ''Finding Dawn'' at NFB.ca] *[http://www.wmm.com/filmcatalog/pages/c725.shtml Women Make Movies] [[Category:2006 films]] [[Category:Documentary films about violence against women]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:National Film Board of Canada documentaries]] [[Category:Documentary films about First Nations]] [[Category:Films shot in Vancouver]] [[Category:Métis film]] [[Category:Documentary films about Indigenous rights in Canada]] [[Category:Highway of Tears]] [[Category:Violence against Indigenous women in Canada]] [[Category:Women and death]] [[Category:2000s documentary films]] [[Category:Métis feminism]] [[Category:Canadian films]]

{{About|the show jumping horse|a person who hunts foxes|Fox hunting|the airborne radar|AI.24 Foxhunter}} {{Infobox sport horse |horsename= Foxhunter |image= |caption= |breed= |sire= Erehwemos (Thoroughbred) |grandsire= Bethlehem (Thoroughbred) |dam= Catcall |damsire= Step Forward (Thoroughbred) |sex= [[Gelding]] |foaled= 1940 |country= Great Britain |colour= [[bay (horse)|Bay]] |breeder= |owner= |trainer= |record= |earnings= |wins= |awards= |honours= |updated= }} '''Foxhunter''' (1940–1959) was a champion [[show jumping]] [[horse]] ridden by [[Harry Llewellyn]], best known for their part in securing [[Great Britain at the 1952 Summer Olympics|Great Britain's only gold medal]] at the [[1952 Summer Olympics]] (in the [[Equestrian at the 1952 Summer Olympics|Team Jumping]] equestrian event).<ref name="independent">{{cite news |first=Genevieve |last=Murphy |title=Sir Harry Llewellyn Bt |format=obituary |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/obituary-sir-harry-llewellyn-bt-1126621.html |work=[[The Independent]] |date=1999-11-17 |accessdate=2008-10-15}}</ref>
They also were part of the British [[Show Jumping]] Team at the [[1948 Summer Olympics]], [[Equestrian at the 1948 Summer Olympics|winning the bronze medal]], and at many other international events.<ref name="independent" />
Foxhunter and Llewellyn are the only horse and rider to win the King George V Gold Cup three times (in 1948, 1950, and 1953), and won 78 international competitions during their joint career.<ref name="independent" />
Llewellyn bought Foxhunter, a golden-[[bay (horse)|bay]] [[gelding]], in 1947 following a search that began by studying the records of every registered showjumper on file with the British Show Jumping Association.<ref name="oundle">{{cite web |url=http://www.oundlesociety.org/SirHarryLlewellyn.asp |title=Sir Harry Llewellyn CBE (1910-1999) |accessdate=2008-10-15 |year=2004 |work=The [[Oundle School|Oundle]] Society web site}}</ref> The horse, who stood {{hands|16.3}} high, was sired by the Thoroughbred stallion Erehwemos out of the half-bred mare Catcall.<ref>{{cite web|author=Hugh McMahon |url=http://www.sporthorse-data.com/d?i=10228636 |title=Foxhunter pedigree |publisher=Sporthorse-data.com |date= |accessdate=2012-07-19}}</ref>
[[File:Foxhunter grave plaque.jpg|right|thumb|Plaque marking the grave of Foxhunter]]Foxhunter died in 1959, and was buried on the [[Blorenge]] mountain, between [[Abergavenny]] and [[Blaenavon]]. A memorial plaque listing Foxhunter's achievements marks the site and a car park is situated nearby. When Sir Harry died in 1999 his ashes were scattered around the horse's memorial.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2012/may/25/olympic-torch-route-guardian-wales |title=Olympic torch route, day 7: Abergavenny's hero, a horse called Foxhunter |date=May 25, 2012 |publisher=The Guardian |author=Eddie Butler}}</ref>
The Foxhunter Championship for novice horses at the annual [[Horse of the Year Show]] was named after Foxhunter,<ref name="independent" /> and was first held in 1954.<ref name="hoys">{{cite journal|title=Young Gun Dan Jumping for Joy|url=http://ts12.gazettelive.co.uk/2009/06/young-gun-dan-jumping-for-joy.html|journal=Evening Gazette|accessdate=2011-05-02|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110831125642/http://ts12.gazettelive.co.uk/2009/06/young-gun-dan-jumping-for-joy.html|archivedate=2011-08-31|df=}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [https://www.panoramio.com/photo/519578 Foxhunter memorial plaque]

The '''Grand Duchess Charlotte Maternity Hospital''' ({{lang-fr|Maternité Grande-Duchesse Charlotte}}) is a [[maternity hospital]], part of the [[Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg]] in [[Luxembourg]]. The hospital is named after [[Charlotte, Grand Duchess of Luxembourg]], who reigned from 1919 to 1964.
==History== In 1936 the development of a maternity hospital in Luxembourg went under the leadership of the [[International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement|Red Cross]] director Dr. M. Bohler and the school of the state of [[Pfaffenthal]], under the control of the state, with the first director Dr. Richard.<ref name="cp">[http://www.chl.lu/maternite/la_maternite_en_bref/historique A propos de la maternité (French)]</ref>
During [[World War II]] the hospital was under control of the state, under the direction of Dr. M. Reile.<ref name="cp" />
In 1951 the first [[Neonatal intensive-care unit|incubator]] was introduced at the hospital. Between 1952 and 1966 the unit of medical gymnastics for childbirth and the gynecology department were opened.<ref name="cp" />
On December 10, 1975, together with the Pediatric Clinic and the [[Municipal Hospital (Luxembourg)|Municipal Hospital]] the [[Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg]] was formed.<ref name="cp" /><ref name="lgx">[http://www.legilux.public.lu/leg/a/archives/1975/0083/a083.pdf#page=8 ''Law of 10 December 1975 establishing a public institution called the Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg, grouping Grand Duchess Charlotte Maternity Hospital, Pediatric Clinic Foundation Grand Duke Jean and Grand Duchess Josephine-Charlotte and the City Hospital'' (French)]</ref> == Famous births == [[Henri, Grand Duke of Luxembourg|Grand Duke Henri]] and [[Maria Teresa, Grand Duchess of Luxembourg|Grand Duchess Maria Theresa]]'s children [[Guillaume, Hereditary Grand Duke of Luxembourg|Prince Guillaume]], [[Prince Félix of Luxembourg|Prince Felix]] , [[Prince Louis of Luxembourg|Prince Louis]], [[Princess Alexandra of Luxembourg|Princess Alexandra ]] and [[Prince Sébastien of Luxembourg|Prince Sebastian]] were born in Grand Duchess Charlotte Maternity Hospital.
[[Prince Louis of Luxembourg|Prince Louis]] and [[Princess Tessy of Luxembourg|Princess Tessy]]'s son Noah was born in 21 September 2007 at the Grand Duchess Charlotte Maternity Hospital.
[[Prince Félix of Luxembourg|Prince Felix]] and [[Princess Claire of Luxembourg|Princess Claire]]'s Daughter [[Princess Amalia of Nassau|Amalia]] was born in 15 June 2014 at the Grand Duchess Charlotte Maternity Hospital.
==References== {{reflist}}
== See also == *[[Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg]] *[[Municipal Hospital (Luxembourg)|Municipal Hospital]]
==Further reading== * [[Antoine Prum|Prum, Antoine]]: ''Maternité Grande-Duchesse Charlotte'' in: ''L'architecture moderniste à Luxembourg. Les années 30.'' S. 36 - S. 41, Musée d'histoire de la Ville de Luxembourg, 1997, {{ISBN|2-919878-02-6}}.
==External links== *[http://www.chl.lu/maternite/front Grand Duchess Charlotte Maternity Hospital website (French)]
{{coord|49|37|02.9|N|6|05|57.2|E|type:landmark|display=title}}

[[Category:1936 establishments in Luxembourg]]

revision.text:
{{infobox book | <!-- See [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Novels]] or [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Books]] --> | name = Hell's Doorway | title_orig = | translator = | image = | caption = | author = [[F. J. Thwaites]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = Australia | language = English | series = | genre = Adventure novel | publisher = Jackson & O'Sullivan | release_date = 1932 | english_release_date = | media_type = | pages = | isbn = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Hell's Doorway''''' is an adventure novel by Australian author [[F. J. Thwaites]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article104209459 |title=His Second Book|newspaper=[[The Land (newspaper)|The Land]] |location=Sydney |date=5 August 1932 |accessdate=29 October 2014 |page=24 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
==Plot== Vallance Hunter is a Sydney medical student whose mother is dying of cancer. Vallance euthanizes her and is sent to prison. After two years, he escapes from [[Goulburn Gaol]] and goes to live on a cattle station in the [[Wolgan Valley]] run by a grazier and his daughter. He falls in love with the daughter and goes blind.
==Background== Sales of the novel boomed after it was read out on [[2UE]] radio.<ref>{{cite web|first=Ron|last=Blaber|title=Thwaites, Frederick Joseph (1908–1979)|website=[[Australian Dictionary of Biography]]|publisher=National Centre of Biography, [[Australian National University]]| url=http://adb.anu.edu.au/biography/thwaites-frederick-joseph-8810/text15453|accessdate=29 October 2014}} Published in hard copy 1990.</ref> It sold over 27,000 copies.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article140485179 |title=Australian Novelist|newspaper=[[Camden News]] |location=NSW |date=15 February 1934 |accessdate=29 October 2014 |page=8 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
==Reception== The book critic in the ''[[Sydney Morning Herald]]'' said that "Mr Thwaites writes vigorously and extracts the last ounce of excitement from the sensational elements of his plot. His characters, however, appear to be somewhat unreal, probably because Mr Thwaites has not mastered the art of writing good dialogue, and because he is regrettably prone to sentimentality."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16899279 |title=Lady Longford Makes More Conversation|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=26 August 1932 |accessdate=30 October 2014 |page=4 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.austlit.edu.au/austlit/page/C576865 ''Hell's Doorway''] at [[AustLit]]
{{F. J. Thwaites}}
[[Category:1932 Australian novels]] [[Category:Australian adventure novels]] [[Category:Novels set in New South Wales]] [[Category:Euthanasia in fiction]] [[Category:Prisons in fiction]]

'''International Day of the Midwife''' was first celebrated [[May 5]]th 1991, and has since been observed in over 50 nations around the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.internationalmidwives.org/ |title=ICM - Home |publisher=Internationalmidwives.org |date= |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref>
The idea of having a day to recognize and honor [[Midwifery|midwives]] came out of the 1987 [[International Confederation of Midwives]] conference in the [[Netherlands]]. In 2014 it was celebrated in Iran<ref>{{cite news|title=Iran needs young population to make progress: Leader|url=http://www.tehrantimes.com/politics/115544-iran-needs-young-population-to-make-progress-leader|accessdate=29 March 2015|publisher=Tehran Times|date=5 May 2014}}</ref> and New Zealand<ref>{{cite news|title=Midwives make history|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/timaru-herald/news/9993318/Midwives-make-history|accessdate=29 March 2015|publisher=Stuff.co.nz|date=30 April 2014}}</ref> among other places.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.mana.org/IntMidDay.html]
[[Category:May observances]] [[Category:Midwifery]] [[Category:International observances|Midwives]]

{{Infobox film | name = Ivans Xtc | image = Ivans Xtc Film poster.jpg | alt = | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Bernard Rose (director)|Bernard Rose]] | producer = Lisa Enos | screenplay = Bernard Rose
Lisa Enos | based on = {{based on|[[Leo Tolstoy]]|''[[The Death of Ivan Ilyich]]''}} | starring = [[Danny Huston]]
[[Peter Weller]] | music = Matt Schultz
Elmo Weber | cinematography = Ron Forsythe
Bernard Rose | editing = Bernard Rose | studio = Enos/Rose Productions | distributor = Artistic License Films
[[Palisades Tartan|Metro-Tartan Distribution]] | released = {{Film date|2000|09|12|[[Toronto International Film Festival|TIFF]]|2002|07|07|New York/Los Angeles|2002|07|19|United Kingdom}} | runtime = 93 minutes | country = United Kingdom
United States | language = English | budget = $136,000{{cite news |first=Peter |last=Tonguette |title=ivansxtc. and the Future of Digital Filmmaking: An Interview With Bernard Rose |url=http://www.thefilmjournal.com/issue5/bernardrose.html |work=The Film Journal |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} | gross = $47,027{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=main&id=ivansxtc.htm |title=Ivans XTC |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} }} '''''Ivans Xtc''''' (sometimes stylized as '''''ivansxtc''''') is 2000 British–American [[Independent film|independent]] drama film co-written and directed by [[Bernard Rose (director)|Bernard Rose]] and starring [[Danny Huston]] and [[Peter Weller]]. It is based on [[Leo Tolstoy]]'s novella ''[[The Death of Ivan Ilyich]]'' and is Rose's second adaptation of his work, after ''[[Anna Karenina (1997 film)|Anna Karenina]]'' in 1997. The film premiered at the [[Toronto International Film Festival]] on September 12, 2000. It was released in the United States (New York and Los Angeles) on July 7, 2002 and on July 19, 2002 in the United Kingdom. ==Cast== * [[Danny Huston]] as Ivan Beckman, a successful film agent working in [[Los Angeles]]. * [[Peter Weller]] as Don West, Beckman's client. * Lisa Enos as Charlotte White * [[James Merendino]] as Danny McTeague * Adam Krentzman as Barry Oaks * [[Sarah Danielle Madison]] as Naomi * [[Tiffani Thiessen]] as Marie Stein * [[Dan Ireland]] as Ted Zimblest * [[Lisa Henson]] as Margaret Mead * [[Hal Lieberman]] as Lloyd Hall * [[Valeria Golino]] as Constanza Vero * [[Angela Featherstone]] as Amanda Hill * [[Victoria Silvstedt]] as Melanie ==Filming== The film was shot in 1999 in Los Angeles, using a skeleton crew and a Sony HDW-700A [[Digital cinematography|digital]] camera, shooting on the recently introduced [[HD video]] format.{{cite web |url=http://www.artlic.com/press/kits/ivans_xtc_kit.html |title=ivans xtc. |work=Artistic License Films |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} ==Reception== ===Box office=== On its opening weekend in the United States and Canada, the film was ranked at #71, behind ''[[The Salton Sea (2002 film)|The Salton Sea]]'', ''[[The Singles Ward]]'' and ''[[Beauty and the Beast (1991 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?yr=2002&wknd=23&p=.htm |title=June 7–9, 2002, Weekend |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} ===Critical response=== ''Ivans Xtc'' received mostly positive reviews. On film aggregation website [[Rotten Tomatoes]], it holds a 75% rating, with an average score of 6.8/10, sampled from reviews from 28 critics.{{cite web |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/ivans_xtc/ |title=Ivans XTC. (2000) |work=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} It scored a 67/100 (citing "generally favorable reviews") on [[Metacritic]], based on reviews from 14 critics.{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/ivansxtc |title=Ivansxtc |work=Metacritic |accessdate=February 9, 2014}} ==Accolades== {| class="wikitable sortable" width="95%" ! colspan="4" style="background: LightSteelBlue;" | Awards |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! Award ! Category ! Recipients and nominees ! Result |- | [[British Independent Film Awards]] | Best Foreign Independent Film – English Language | | {{nominated}} |- | [[Independent Film Festival of Boston]] | Narrative | [[Bernard Rose (director)|Bernard Rose]] | {{won}} |- | rowspan="4"|[[Independent Spirit Awards]] | Best Director | Bernard Rose | {{nom}} |- | Best Supporting Male | [[Peter Weller]] | {{nom}} |- | Best Male Lead | [[Danny Huston]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Independent Spirit John Cassavetes Award]] | Bernard Rose and Lisa Enos | {{nom}} |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{imdb title|id=0238321|title=Ivansxtc}} {{Bernard Rose}} [[Category:Films based on works by Leo Tolstoy]] [[Category:Films based on Russian novels]] [[Category:2000 films]] [[Category:British independent films]] [[Category:American independent films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:2000s drama films]] [[Category:Films directed by Bernard Rose (director)]] [[Category:Films about death]] [[Category:Rhino Films films]]

revision.text:
'''Julaybib''' ([[Arabic]]: جليبيب) was a martyr and one of the less known companions of Prophet [[Muhammad]] in the early [[Muslim]] community. His name was acquired prior to his acceptance of [[Islam]] and is considered unusual and incomplete. In the [[Arabic language]] ''Julaybib'' means "small grown" being the diminutive form of the word ''jalbab'', indicating that Julaybib was small and short, even dwarf-like. He was also described as being ''damim'', meaning ugly, deformed, or repulsive.
Julaybib's lineage was unknown and there is no record of his parents or what tribe he belonged to. All that was known of him was that he was an [[Arab]] and that he was one of the [[Ansar (Islam)|Ansar]] in [[Medina]].
With Julaybib in mind, Muhammad went to an Ansari man and said: "I want to have your daughter married." "How wonderful and blessed, O Messenger of God and what a delight to the eye (this would be)," he replied. "I do not want her for myself," added Muhammad. "Then for whom, O Messenger of God?" asked the man, obviously disappointed. "For Julaybib," said Muhammad. The Ansari went to consult with his wife, telling her of Muhammad's desire for their daughter to marry Julaybib. His wife was repulsed, and protested saying "To Julaybib! No, never to Julaybib! No, by God, we shall not marry (her) to him."
While the Ansari was preparing to inform Muhammad of what his wife said, the daughter hearing her mother's protestations, asked: "Who has asked you to marry me?"
It is said that she the daughter was so beautiful that there was none among the women of that clan who could compete with her looks. She was so shy and modest that perhaps the sky itself had never seen her head uncovered. She had so much fear of her creator and piety, that she would spend her days and nights in worship.The daughter asked what was happening, she was told that the Messenger of God wants your hand in marriage for Julaybib. As the Mother continued her crying and wailing the daughter spoke she said, "O my Mother fear Allah think of what you are saying are you turning away the Messenger of God. 'O my Mother it does not suit a believer to make their own decision once God and his Messenger have decided on a matter. Do you think that the Messenger of God will disgrace us? How blessed is the status of Julaybib, that God and his Messenger are asking for your daughter's hand on his behalf. Don't you know that the angels themselves envy the dust on the feet of one who is a beloved of God and His Messenger. Ask the Messenger to send me Julaybib for there is no greater privilege than for me to be blessed by such a husband, the Messenger of God has arrived with such a wonderful gift yet my Mother you cry and wail."
She was married by Muhammad to Julaybib and they lived together until he was martyred in an expedition.
On the day of the expedition his father in law, had pleaded with him: "'O Julaybib this is just an expedition, it is not a compulsory Jihad, it is a voluntary Jihad, therefore you are newly married spend some time with your wife."
Julaybib, the one who had spent a lifetime in despair, had now found a loving wife. But he replied to his father in law's request and said, " 'O my father you say a strange thing, my Beloved Prophet is in the battlefield facing the enemies of Islam and you want me to sit at home with my wife, nay I will sacrifice my blood and my soul rather than see my Prophet facing hardship while I sit at home in luxury".
Julaybib participated in an expedition with Muhammad in which an encounter with some enemies ensued.
After that battle the Prophet of God, asked his companions to go and to see if anyone was missing from their family's and clans. Each one returned accounting for all his family members. Then the Prophet spoke with tears in his eyes he said "But I have lost my Beloved Julaybib, go and find him." They found his diminutive body lying next to seven enemies he had slain in the battle.
The Prophet of God asked for a grave to be dug, as the Prophet of God held the body of Julaybib he said. "O' Allah he is from me and I am From Him", he repeated this three times. The companions wept profusely "May our Mothers and Fathers be sacrificed for you O' Julaybib, how great is your status." Thus a companion who had once lived as an outcast, shunned by the society around him. He loved God and his Messenger and reached such a high status. He who was not good looking was blessed with a beautiful wife, he who was poor was blessed by a wealthy wife, he who had no family or status, was blessed by a wife with noble status and lineage he who had lived in loneliness and despair, was loved by Allah and his messenger, He had the Messenger of God say: " O Allah he is from me and I am from him."
It is said: "That upon his martyrdom, that the sky itself was filled with thousands of angels who had come to participate in his funeral."
Julaybib 'The Lonesome one' had become a beloved of Allah, and his prophet, he was lonely no more. Such is the status of the lovers of the Prophet.
As for his wife it is said that there was no widow whose hand was more sought after in marriage than hers.
==Sources== Musnad Ahmad, Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal
== See also == * [[Salaf]] * [[Sahaba]]
[[Category:People killed in action]] [[Category:Male Sahabah]]

{{use dmy dates|date=July 2015}} [[File:Venuspioneeruv.jpg|250px|thumb|The atmosphere of Venus as viewed in ultraviolet by the [[Pioneer Venus Orbiter]] in 1979.]] {{Life in the Universe}}
The speculation of life currently existing on [[Venus]] decreased significantly since the early 1960s, when spacecraft began studying Venus and it became clear that the conditions on Venus are extreme compared to those on Earth.
Venus's location closer to the [[Sun]] than [[Earth]] and the extreme [[greenhouse effect]] raising temperatures on the surface to nearly {{convert|735|K|C}}, and the atmospheric pressure 90 times that of Earth, make water-based [[life]] as we know it unlikely on the surface of the planet. However, a few scientists have speculated that thermoacidophilic [[extremophile]] [[microorganisms]] might exist in the lower-temperature, acidic upper layers of the Venusian atmosphere.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.newscientist.com/article/dn2843-acidic-clouds-of-venus-could-harbour-life.html|title=Acidic clouds of Venus could harbour life|work=New Scientist|first=Stuart|last=Clark|date=26 September 2003|accessdate=30 December 2015}}</ref><ref>Redfern, Martin (25 May 2004). [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/3746583.stm "Venus clouds 'might harbour life'"]. ''BBC News''. Retrieved 30 December 2015.</ref><ref name="Dartnell2015">{{cite journal |title=Constraints on a potential aerial biosphere on Venus: I. Cosmic rays |journal=Icarus |date=September 2015 |last=Dartnell |first=Lewis R. |last2=Nordheim |first2=Tom Andre |last3= Patel |first3=Manish R. |last4=Mason |first4= Jonathon P. |volume=257 |pages=396–405 |doi=10.1016/j.icarus.2015.05.006 |url=http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0019103515002080 |accessdate=20 August 2015 |display-authors=etal|bibcode = 2015Icar..257..396D }}</ref>
==Historical views==
Until the mid 20th century, the surface environment of Venus was believed to be similar to Earth, and hence it was widely believed that Venus could harbor life. In 1870, the British astronomer [[Richard Proctor]] said the existence of life on Venus was impossible near its equator,<ref>Proctor, Richard A., ''Other Worlds Than Ours: The Plurality of Worlds Studied Under the Light of Recent Scientific Researches''. New York : J.A. Hill and Co., 1870. s. 94.</ref> but possible near its poles.
Since the 1960s, increasingly clear evidence from various space probes showed Venus has an extreme climate, with a [[greenhouse effect]] generating a constant temperature of about 500 °C on the surface. The atmosphere contains [[sulfuric acid]] clouds and the atmospheric pressure at the surface is 90 [[Bar (unit)|bar]], almost 100 times that of Earth and similar to that of more than {{convert|1000|m|ft|abbr=on}} deep in Earth's oceans. In such environment, and given the increasingly hostile characteristics of the Venusian weather, the chances of life as we know it are excluded from the surface of Venus.
In September 1967, Carl Sagan and Harold Morowitz published an analysis of the issue of life on Venus to the journal ''Nature''.<ref name=":0">{{Cite journal|title=Life on Venus|journal=Astrobiology|volume=11|issue=9|pages=931|via=Academic OneFile|doi=10.1089/ast.2011.9270|pmid=22059693|bibcode=2011AsBio..11..931M|year=2011|last1=Morowitz|first1=Harold}}</ref>
==Habitability of its atmosphere== Although there is little possibility of existing life near the surface of Venus, the altitudes about 50 km above the surface have a mild temperature, and hence there are still some opinions in favor of such a possibility in the [[atmosphere of Venus]].<ref>[http://www.maik.ru/cgi-perl/search.pl?type=abstract&name=solsys&number=1&year=12&page=41 Venus as a Natural Laboratory for Search of Life in High Temperature Conditions: Events on the Planet on March 1, 1982], L. V. Ksanfomality, published in [http://www.maik.ru/contents/solsys/solsys1_12v46cont.htm ''Astronomicheskii Vestnik'', Vol. 46, No. 1, 2012] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304051810/http://www.maik.ru/contents/solsys/solsys1_12v46cont.htm |date= 4 March 2016 }}.</ref><ref name=Landis2003b />
In the analysis of mission data from the ''[[Venera program|Venera]]'', [[Pioneer Venus project|Pioneer Venus]] and ''[[Magellan (spacecraft)|Magellan]]'' missions, it was discovered that [[carbonyl sulfide]], [[hydrogen sulfide]] and [[sulfur dioxide]] were present together in the upper atmosphere. ''Venera'' also detected large amounts of toxic [[chlorine]] just below the Venusian cloud cover.<ref>[https://www.amazon.com/dp/0201328399/ Venus Revealed: A New Look Below the Clouds of Our Mysterious Twin Planet], David Grinspoon, {{ISBN|978-0-201-32839-4}}</ref> Carbonyl sulfide is difficult to produce inorganically,<ref name=Landis2003b>{{cite journal| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110807004311/http://gltrs.grc.nasa.gov/reports/2003/TM-2003-212310.pdf| url=http://gltrs.grc.nasa.gov/reports/2003/TM-2003-212310.pdf| archivedate=7 August 2011| title=Astrobiology: the Case for Venus| last=Landis| first=Geoffrey A.| journal=Journal of the British Interplanetary Society| volume=56| issue=7/8| date=2003| pages=250–254| bibcode = 2003JBIS...56..250L }}</ref> but it can be produced by [[Volcanology of Venus|volcanism]].<ref name="Seinfeld 2006">{{cite book | last = Seinfeld | first = J. | title = Atmospheric Chemistry and Physics | publisher = J. Wiley | location = London | year = 2006 | isbn = 978-1-60119-595-1 }}</ref> Sulfuric acid is produced in the upper atmosphere by the Sun's [[photochemistry|photochemical]] action on [[carbon dioxide]], [[sulfur dioxide]], and water vapour.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://m.esa.int/Our_Activities/Space_Science/Venus_Express/Acid_clouds_and_lightning |title=Venus Express: Acid clouds and lightning |work=European Space Agency (ESA) |accessdate=2016-09-08 }}</ref>
Solar radiation constrains the atmospheric habitable zone to between 51 km (65 °C) and 62 km (−20 °C) altitude, within the acidic clouds.<ref name='Dartnell2015'/> It has been speculated that clouds in the atmosphere of Venus could contain chemicals that can initiate forms of biological activity.<ref>{{cite web|last=David|first=Leonard|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030216063036/http://www.space.com/scienceastronomy/astrobio_venus_030211.html|url=http://www.space.com/scienceastronomy/astrobio_venus_030211.html|title=Life Zone on Venus Possible|website=Space.com|date=11 February 2003|archivedate=16 February 2003 |accessdate=30 December 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |first1=Dirk | last1=Schulze-Makuch |first2=David H. | last2=Grinspoon |first3=Ousama | last3=Abbas |first4=Louis N. | last4=Irwin |first5=Mark A. | last5=Bullock | title = A Sulfur-Based Survival Strategy for Putative Phototrophic Life in the Venusian Atmosphere. | journal = Astrobiology | volume = 4 | number = 1 | pages = 11–18 | date = March 2004 | doi= 10.1089/153110704773600203|bibcode = 2004AsBio...4...11S | pmid=15104900}}</ref> It has been speculated that any hypothetical microorganisms inhabiting the atmosphere, if present, could employ [[ultraviolet light]] (UV) emitted by the Sun as an energy source, which could be an explanation for the dark lines observed in the UV photographs of Venus.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/cgi-bin/common/printfriendly.pl?/news/scitech/2002/09/item20020926135029_1.htm|title=Venus could be a haven for life|work=ABC News|date=28 September 2002|accessdate=30 December 2015}}</ref><ref name="Schulze">{{cite journal |title=Reassessing the Possibility of Life on Venus: Proposal for an Astrobiology Mission |journal=Astrobiology |date=5 July 2004 |last=Schulze-Makuch |first=Dirk |last2=Irwin |first2=Louis N. |volume=2 |issue=2 |pages=197–202 |doi=10.1089/15311070260192264 |url=http://online.liebertpub.com/doi/abs/10.1089/15311070260192264 |accessdate=20 August 2015 |bibcode = 2002AsBio...2..197S |pmid=12469368}}</ref>
==Past habitability potential== It is plausible that microbial life originated on Venus if liquid water existed on its surface prior to the heating of the planet by the [[runaway greenhouse effect]], but no longer exists.<ref name= "Forbes">Bruce Dorminey, [https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucedorminey/2016/03/28/venus-likely-had-past-life-next-step-is-finding-it/ "Venus Likely Had Past Life; Next Step Is Finding It"], ''Forbes'', Mar 28, 2016.</ref> Assuming [[Origin of water on Earth|the process that delivered water to Earth]] was common to all the planets near the habitable zone, it has been estimated that liquid water could have existed on its surface for up to 600 million years during and shortly after the [[Late Heavy Bombardment]], which could be enough time for simple life to form, but this figure can vary from as little as a few million years to as much as few billion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.esa.int/Our_Activities/Space_Science/Venus_Express/Was_Venus_once_a_habitable_planet |title=Was Venus once a habitable planet? |date=24 June 2010 |publisher=[[European Space Agency]] |accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.universetoday.com/67240/was-venus-once-a-waterworld/ |title=Was Venus once a waterworld? |date=24 June 2010 |author=Nancy Atkinson |publisher=[[Universe Today]] |accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.space.com/283-venus-alive-signs.html |title=Was Venus Alive? 'The Signs are Probably There' |date=26 August 2004 |author=Henry Bortman |publisher=''[[Space.com]]'' |accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nasa.gov/feature/goddard/2016/nasa-climate-modeling-suggests-venus-may-have-been-habitable |title=NASA Climate Modeling Suggests Venus May Have Been Habitable |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=August 11, 2016 |website=NASA.gov |publisher=[[NASA]] |access-date=August 15, 2016 |quote=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal|arxiv=1608.00706 |title=Was Venus the First Habitable World of our Solar System?' |journal=Geophysical Research Letters |volume=43 |issue=16 |pages=8376 |date=2 August 2016 |author=Michael J. Way |doi=10.1002/2016GL069790 |bibcode=2016GeoRL..43.8376W }}</ref> This might also have given enough time for microbial life to evolve to be aerial.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dailygalaxy.com/my_weblog/2012/06/did-the-early-venus-harbor-life-weekend-feature.html |title=Did the Early Venus Harbor Life? (Weekend Feature) |date=2 June 2012 |publisher=''The Daily Galaxy''|accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref> There has been very little analysis of Venusian surface material, so it is possible that evidence of past life, if it ever existed, could be found with a probe capable of enduring Venus's current extreme surface conditions,<ref name=":0" /><ref name=Shiga>{{cite web |url=https://www.newscientist.com/article/dn12769-did-venuss-ancient-oceans-incubate-life/ |title=Did Venus’s ancient oceans incubate life? |date=10 October 2007 |author=David Shiga |publisher=''[[New Scientist]]'' |accessdate=22 May 2016}}</ref> although the resurfacing of the planet in the past 500 million years<ref name="Strom1994">{{cite journal |last=Strom |first=Robert G. |author2=Schaber, Gerald G. |author3=Dawson, Douglas D. |date=25 May 1994 |title=The global resurfacing of Venus |journal=[[Journal of Geophysical Research]] |volume=99 |issue=E5 |pages=10899–10926 |doi=10.1029/94JE00388 |bibcode=1994JGR....9910899S}}</ref> means that it is unlikely that ancient surface rocks remain, especially those containing the mineral [[tremolite]] which, theoretically, could have encased some [[biosignatures]].<ref name=Shiga/>
==See also== *[[Colonization of Venus]] *[[Life on Mars]] *[[Life on Titan]] *[[Life on Europa]] *[[Life on Enceladus]] *''[[All Summer in a Day]]'' - short story by Ray Bradbury

revision.text:
{{short description|garment worn inside a spacesuit for cooling and ventilation}} [[Image:lcvg.jpg|thumb|175px|A man wearing a Liquid Cooling and Ventilation Garment for the [[Space Shuttle]]/[[International Space Station]] [[Extravehicular Mobility Unit]] (EMU)]]
A '''Liquid Cooling Garment''' (LCG) is a [[form-fitting garment]] that is used to remove [[body heat]] from the wearer in environments where [[evaporative cooling]] from [[sweating]] and open-air [[convection cooling]] does not work, or the wearer has a biological problem that hinders self-regulation of body temperature.
A '''Liquid Cooling and Ventilation Garment''' (LCVG) has additional crush-resistant [[ventilation duct]]s, which draw moist air from the wearer's extremities, keeping the wearer dry. In a fully enclosing suit where exhaled breathing air can enter the suit, the exhaled air is moist and can lead to an uncomfortable feeling of dampness or wetness.
While this technology is most commonly associated with [[space suit]]s, it is also used in a wide range of Earth-bound applications where open-air cooling is difficult or impossible to achieve, such as [[fire fighting]], working in a [[steel mill]] and increasingly by surgeons during long or strenuous procedures.
== Technology == There are typically two parts to a liquid cooling garment: * the heat collection garment and tubing * a heat exchanger for removal of heat from the circulated fluid
=== Garment and tubing === The garment is typically a close-fitting non-stretching fabric or a tight-fitting elastic fabric, with flexible tubing sewn onto the fabric. A single layer of fabric may be used, with the tubing either on the inside directly contacting the wearer's skin, or on the outside separated by the fabric. If two layers of fabric are used, stitched channels can be formed which enclose the tubing between the two fabric layers. Where flame resistance is needed, the garment may be constructed out of materials such as [[nomex]].
The tubing is typically a few millimeters in diameter, and may be made out of any number of flexible plastics such as [[polyvinyl chloride]] (PVC) or [[silicone]]. Smaller diameter tubing permits a higher degree of garment flexibility, but at a cost of lower heat absorption capacity, and increased pressure needed to push liquid through the tubing.
When a large area needs to be cooled or the external environment also heats the tubing, a single long tube may not be enough because the liquid becomes saturated with heat and cannot cool any further. Making the liquid much colder is not an option since it leads to uncomfortable coldness where the liquid enters the tubes. Instead, multiple parallel tubes are used to increase the volume of liquid available to absorb heat.
Skin coverage and tubing density can vary depending on the application. The garment may simply be a short-sleeved shirt, or it may be a full-body suit covering the arms and legs. Where the heat removal requirement is low, the tubing may be spaced several centimeters apart across the garment surface. Where there is a very large amount of heat to remove, the tubing can be arranged in a dense grid with no gaps between the tubes.
=== Heat exchanger === For portable earthbound applications, the heat exchanger for cooling the liquid can be very low-tech, consisting simply of a container for holding ice, and an electric pump to circulate water from the container through the tubing. The return water is cooled by the melting ice and again pumped through the tubes. Regulation of flow is done by varying pump speed or using an adjustable flow valve. Ice storage can be achieved using a belt-pack, a backpack, or a duffel bag, depending on the length of time needed for the cooling system to operate between refilling the ice storage.
In situations where the wearer must stay in place inside a vehicle, heavy but long-term-operation heat exchangers can be used, such as a refrigeration system to cool the liquid.
When the user's movement is partially hindered through the use of a life-support umbilical, cooling liquid can also be supplied via the umbilical.
== Space applications == [[Astronauts]] commonly wear a Liquid Cooling and Ventilation Garment in order to maintain a comfortable [[core temperature|core body temperature]] during [[extra-vehicular activity]] (EVA). The LCVG accomplishes this task by circulating cool water through a network of flexible tubes in direct contact with the astronaut's skin. The water draws heat away from the body, resulting in a lower core temperature. The water then returns to the [[Primary Life Support System]] (PLSS), where it is cooled in a [[heat exchanger]] before being recirculated.
In an independent space suit, the heat is ultimately transferred to a thin sheet of ice (formed by a separate feed water source). Due to the extremely low pressure in space, the heated ice [[Sublimation (chemistry)|sublimates]] directly to water vapor, which is then vented away from the suit.
The ice sublimator consists of sintered nickel plates with microscopic pores which are sized to permit the water to freeze in the plate without damaging it. So when heat needs to be removed, the ice in the pores melts and the water passes through them to form a thin sheet which sublimates (like dry ice). When there is no heat needing to be removed, this water refreezes sealing the plate. The rate of sublimation of the ice is directly proportional to the amount of heat needing to be removed, so the system is self-regulating needing no moving parts. During EVA on the Moon, it had outlet gas temperature of {{cvt|44|F}},<ref>Carson, Maurice A. "Apollo Portable Life Support System Performance Report." Second Conference On Portable Life Systems. 1971, Page 54</ref> As an example, during the Apollo 12 commander's first EVA (of 3 hrs, 44 minutes), {{cvt|4.75|lb}} of feedwater were sublimated, and this dissipated {{cvt|894.4|Btu/h|W}}.<ref>Carson, Maurice A. "Apollo Portable Life Support System Performance Report." Second Conference On Portable Life Systems. 1971, Page 60</ref> The pores eventually get clogged through contamination and the plates need to be replaced.,<ref>Thomas, Kenneth S., and Harold J. McMann. [https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=Qlo_kJwtyZoC&pg=PA120 US spacesuits, page 120 and following]. Springer Science & Business Media, 2011.</ref>
In a dependent space suit (such as the ones used in the [[Gemini program]] or within lunar orbit on the [[Apollo program]]), the heat is carried back to a host spacecraft through an [[Umbilical cable|umbilical]] connection, where it is ultimately radiated or sublimated via the spacecraft's own thermal control system.
Because the [[space environment]] is essentially a [[vacuum]], heat cannot be lost through [[heat convection]], and can only be directly dissipated through [[thermal radiation]], a much slower process. Thus, even though the environment of space can be extremely cold, excessive heat build-up is inevitable. Without an LCVG, there would be no means by which to expel this heat, and it would affect not only EVA performance, but the health of the suit occupant as well. The LCVG used with the [[Apollo/Skylab A7L]] suit could remove heat at a rate of approximately 586 [[watt]]s.<ref>{{cite book | last = Carson | first = Maurice A. | authorlink = |author2=Rouen, Michael N. |author3=Lutz, Charles C. |author4=McBarron, James W. II | title = Biomedical Results of Apollo - Section VI - Chapter 6 - Extravehicular Mobility Unit | publisher = Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center | location = | pages = | url = http://lsda.jsc.nasa.gov/books/apollo/S6CH6.htm | doi = | id = }}</ref>
The LCVG used with [[NASA]]'s [[Extravehicular Mobility Unit]] is primarily constructed of [[spandex]], with a [[nylon]] [[wiktionary:tricot|tricot]] liner.<ref>{{cite web | last = Freudenrich | first = Craig C. | title = How Spacesuits Work | work = How Stuff Works | url = http://www.howstuffworks.com/space-suit4.htm | accessdate = 2007-01-18 }} </ref> The tubes are made of [[polyvinyl chloride]].
==Images== <center> <gallery perrow="5"> Image:Apollo 11 space suit.jpg| Apollo/Skylab A7L with LCVG Image:Orlan cooling suit.JPG| Old Orlan LCVG Image:Orlan LCG Michael Foale Expedition 8.jpg | Current Orlan LCVG </gallery> </center>

{{about|the Uruguayan footballer|the Spanish footballer|Luis Suárez Miramontes|other people named Luis Suárez|Luis Suárez (disambiguation)}} {{pp-blp|small=yes}} {{EngvarB|date=April 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Spanish name|Suárez|Díaz}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Luis Suárez | image = Luis Suárez 2018.jpg | image_size = 220px | caption = Suárez lining up for [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] | fullname = Luis Alberto Suárez Díaz<ref name="FIFA">{{cite web |url=http://www.fifadata.com/document/fwc/2014/pdf/fwc_2014_squadlists.pdf |title=2014 FIFA World Cup Brazi: List of Players: Uruguay |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=31 |date=14 July 2014 |accessdate=22 March 2016}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|1|24|df=y}}<ref name="FIFA"/> | birth_place = [[Salto, Uruguay]] | height = 1.82 m<ref name="BarcelonaProfile">{{cite web|url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/staff/players/2017-2018/luis-suarez |title=Luis Suárez |publisher= FC Barcelona |accessdate=5 April 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | clubnumber = 9 | youthyears1 = 2003–2005 | youthclubs1 = [[Club Nacional de Football|Nacional]] | years1 = 2005–2006 | clubs1 = [[Club Nacional de Football|Nacional]] | caps1 = 27 | goals1 = 10 | years2 = 2006–2007 | clubs2 = [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] | caps2 = 29 | goals2 = 10 | years3 = 2007–2011 | clubs3 = [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] | caps3 = 110 | goals3 = 81 | years4 = 2011–2014 | clubs4 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps4 = 110 | goals4 = 69 | years5 = 2014– | clubs5 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | caps5 = 143 | goals5 = 119<!--LEAGUE ONLY--> | nationalyears1 = 2006–2007 | nationalteam1 = [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalteam2 = [[Uruguay Olympic football team|Uruguay U23]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 3 | nationalyears3 = 2007– | nationalteam3 = [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] | nationalcaps3 = 106 | nationalgoals3 = 55 | pcupdate = 24 November 2018 | ntupdate = 23:39, 20 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Luis Alberto Suárez Díaz''' ({{IPA-es|ˈlwis ˈswaɾes|am}}; born 24 January 1987) is a Uruguayan professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for Spanish club [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] and the [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay national team]]. Often regarded as one of the best players in the world,{{refn|group=note|<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/ng-interactive/2013/dec/100-greatest-footballers-2013 |title=The 100 best footballers in the world 2013 – interactive |publisher=The Guardian |date=20 December 2013 |accessdate=1 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/25/sports/worldcup/apparent-bite-by-luis-suarez-mars-uruguays-victory-over-italy.html|title=Uruguay's Suárez, Known for Biting, Leaves Mark on World Cup|publisher=The New York Times|date=25 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/FIFA-World-Cup-2014/news/15241/9355292/uruguay-v-england-luis-suarez-proved-he-is-best-in-the-world-says-peter-taylor|title=Uruguay v England: Luis Suarez proved he is best in the world, says Peter Taylor|publisher=SkySports}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Quarrell|first1=Dan|title=Why Luis Suarez is better than Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo – Cristian Rodriguez|url=http://au.eurosport.com/football/liga/2015-2016/why-luis-suarez-is-better-than-lionel-messi-and-cristiano-ronaldo-cristian-rodriguez_sto4920265/story.shtml|publisher=[[Eurosport]]|accessdate=22 September 2015|date=21 September 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/ng-interactive/2016/dec/20/the-100-best-footballers-in-the-world-2016-interactive|title=The 100 best footballers in the world 2016 – interactive|date=20 December 2016|work=The Guardian}}</ref>}} Suárez has won 17 trophies in his career, including five league titles and a [[UEFA Champions League]] title at club level, and a [[Copa América]] with Uruguay. A prolific goalscorer, Suárez has won two [[European Golden Shoe]]s, an [[Eredivisie#Top scorers|Eredivisie Golden Boot]], a [[Premier League Golden Boot]], as well as ending the six-year dominance of [[Lionel Messi]] and [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] by winning La Liga's [[Pichichi Trophy]] in [[2015–16 La Liga|2016]]. He has scored over 400 senior career goals for club and country.<ref name="300 goals">{{cite news|title=Outrageous assist tees up Suarez's 300th|url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/la-liga-wrap-luis-suarez-cashes-in-on-sublime-sergi-roberto-assist-but-real-madrid-remain-top/story-e6frf423-1227589878700|agency=Fox Sports|date=1 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Chris|last=Shaw|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/announcements/285271-luis-suarez-celebrates-400-goal-landmark|title=Luis Suarez celebrates 400-goal landmark|date=24 December 2017|work=Liverpool FC|accessdate=24 December 2017}}</ref>
Suárez began his career as a youth player for [[Club Nacional de Football|Nacional]] in 2003. At age 19, he relocated to the Netherlands to play for [[FC Groningen|Groningen]], before transferring to [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] in 2007. He won his first trophy in 2010, the [[2009–10 KNVB Cup|KNVB Cup]], finishing the season as [[Eredivisie#Top scorers|the league's top scorer]] and was named [[Dutch Footballer of the Year]]. A year later, he helped Ajax secure the [[Eredivisie]] title, and scored his [[List of AFC Ajax records and statistics#All-time topscorers|100th Ajax goal]]. In January 2011, Suárez transferred to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], and won the [[2011–12 Football League Cup|League Cup]] in his first full season. In 2014, he was named the [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]] and the [[FWA Footballer of the Year]] as well as winning the Premier League Golden Boot, and sharing the European Golden Shoe with Cristiano Ronaldo before moving to Barcelona in a transfer worth €82.3 million (£64.98 million), making him [[List of most expensive association football transfers|one of the most expensive players]] in football history.<ref name="Revealed: How much Luis Suarez really cost Barcelona"/><ref name=":1">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/11/liverpool-luis-suarez-barcelona-transfer-medical|title=Liverpool confirm Luis Suárez's £75m move to Barcelona pending medical|date=11 July 2014|work=The Guardian|accessdate=24 August 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140711161731/http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/11/liverpool-luis-suarez-barcelona-transfer-medical|archivedate=11 July 2014}}</ref>
In his first season at Barcelona, Suárez starred in an attacking trio alongside Lionel Messi and [[Neymar]], helping the club win a historic second [[Treble (association football)|continental treble]] of [[La Liga]], the [[Copa del Rey]] and the UEFA Champions League. Messi, Suárez, Neymar (dubbed MSN), scored a total of 122 goals that season, the most for an attacking front three in Spanish football history.<ref name="MSN record"/> In his second season at the club, Suárez won his first [[Pichichi Trophy]] as well as his second European Golden Shoe, for which he became the first player since 2009 to win both awards other than Messi or Ronaldo.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://cnnespanol.cnn.com/2016/05/16/luis-suarez-gana-su-segunda-bota-de-oro/ |title= Luis Suárez gana su segunda Bota de Oro|date=16 May 2016 |accessdate=16 May 2016 |publisher=[[CNN]]|language=spanish}}</ref> He ended the season with a total of 40 league goals, 14 of which came in his last five matches, and 16 assists, becoming the first player in history to top La Liga in both goals and assists.<ref name="Goal.com">{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ie/news/3908/main/2016/05/14/23520352/luis-suarez-barcas-highest-scoring-uruguayan-tops-goals-and?|title=Luis Suarez: Barca's highest-scoring Uruguayan tops goals AND assist charts|date=14 May 2016|work=Goal.com}}</ref><ref name="Luis Suarez Player Profile">{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.us/player/125088/luis-suarez/|title=Luis Suarez Player Profile|date=14 May 2016|work=ESPN}}</ref>
Suárez is Uruguay's [[Uruguay national football team#Records|all-time leading goalscorer]]. At the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] he played an important role in Uruguay's fourth-place finish, scoring three goals, as well as controversially blocking a goal-bound extra time header with his hands during the quarter-final against [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]]. At the [[2011 Copa América]], Suárez scored four goals as Uruguay won a record [[Copa América#Results|fifteenth Copa América]], and he was named [[Copa América#Copa América player of the tournament|Player of the Tournament]].<ref name="CopaAmerica"/> At the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil, Suárez scored his 40th international goal before he was suspended from the tournament after biting Italy defender [[Giorgio Chiellini]]. Suárez has been a source of controversy throughout his career.{{refn|group=note|<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/apr/21/luis-suarez-biting-controversy-timeline |title=Luis Suárez: 10 previous controversies involving the Liverpool striker |date=21 April 2013 |accessdate=25 June 2014 |publisher=The Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.itv.com/worldcup/luis-suarez-a-history-of-controversy |title=Luis Suarez: a history of controversy |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014 |publisher=[[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140709015023/http://www.itv.com/worldcup/luis-suarez-a-history-of-controversy |archivedate=9 July 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/players/luis-suarez/10923947/Luis-Suarez-bites-Giorgio-Chiellini-Uruguay-strikers-career-flashpoints.html |title=Luis Suarez bites Giorgio Chiellini: Uruguay striker's career flashpoints |work=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014}}</ref>}} As well as his goal-line handball, he has also bitten opponents on three separate occasions.{{refn|group=note|<ref name="Cannibal of Ajax">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/nov/22/luis-suarez-biting-otman-bakkal |title=Luis Suárez: 'The Cannibal of Ajax'? |work=The Guardian |agency=Associated Press |date=22 November 2010 |accessdate=23 August 2011}}</ref><ref name="BranBite">{{cite news |last=Fifield |first=Dominic |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2013/apr/21/luis-suarez-bite |title=Luis Suárez's bite has proven again he is a liability, even at his peak |work=The Guardian |date=21 April 2013 |accessdate=21 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Bite3">{{cite news |last=De Menezes |first=Jack |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/worldcup/luis-suarez-bite-uruguay-striker-accused-of-biting-giorgio-chiellini-in-latest-controversy-during-world-cup-clash-9560650.html |title=Luis Suarez bite: Uruguay striker accused of biting Giorgio Chiellini in latest controversy during World Cup clash |work=[[The Independent]] |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Borden |first=Sam |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/25/sports/worldcup/apparent-bite-by-luis-suarez-mars-uruguays-victory-over-italy.html |title=Uruguay's Suárez, Known for Biting, Leaves Mark on World Cup |date=25 June 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2014 |work=[[New York Times]]}}</ref>}} He has also been accused of and admitted to [[Diving (association football)|diving]],<ref name="doeshedive"/><ref name="admitdiving">{{cite web |title=Luis Suarez diving: Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers reveals anger |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21064709 |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |accessdate=19 January 2013}}</ref> and in 2011, the [[the Football Association|FA]] found him guilty of racially abusing [[Patrice Evra]],<ref name="racialguilt"/> a decision Suárez disputes.<ref name="Suarez statement"/>
==Club career== ===Youth=== {{quote box|width=25%|align=right|quote="As I was growing up, there was only one player I looked up to, and that was Batistuta, the Argentina No.9."|source=—Suárez on his idol growing up, [[Gabriel Batistuta]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Suarez: Why I used to watch Batistuta |url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/163126-suarez-why-i-used-to-watch-batistuta |accessdate=15 August 2018 |agency=Liverpool FC}}</ref>}} Suárez lived his early years at the Cerro neighbourhood in Salto, where he played youth football at Sportivo Artigas.<ref>[http://www.ovaciondigital.com.uy/futbol/salta-pibe-barrio.html Suárez Capítulo 1: El "Salta", aquel pibe de barrio] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170801163702/http://www.ovaciondigital.com.uy/futbol/salta-pibe-barrio.html |date=1 August 2017 }} – Enrique Arrillaga / Ángel Asteggiante, El País, 19 October 2014</ref> At age seven, he moved with his family (parents and six brothers) to Montevideo, where he played youth football at Urreta FC.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44289268|title=World Cup 2018: The making of Uruguay and Barcelona forward Luis Suarez|date=14 June 2018|publisher=BBC Sport| accessdate=14 June 2018}}</ref>
===Nacional=== Suárez joined local side [[Club Nacional de Football|Nacional]]'s youth team at age 14.<ref name="Pearce 1-2">{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-fc/lfc-player-profiles/luis-suarez/2011/02/09/luis-suarez-s-rise-from-the-streets-of-montevideo-to-liverpool-fc-hero-part-one-100252-28138725/2/ |title=Luis Suarez's rise from the streets of Montevideo to Liverpool FC hero – part one |first=James|last=Pearce |work=Liverpool Echo|publisher=Trinity Mirror |page=2 |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=21 August 2011}}</ref> At age 16, Suárez [[headbutt]]ed a referee following a red card.<ref name="ESPNportrait">{{cite web |url=http://espn.go.com/espn/feature/story/_/id/10984370/portrait-serial-winner-luis-suarez-soccer-most-beautiful-player |title=Portrait of a Serial Winner |first=Wright |last=Thompson |work=[[ESPN The Magazine]] |date=27 May 2014 |accessdate=22 June 2014 }}</ref> One night, he was caught drinking and partying, prompting his coach to threaten he would never play unless he started playing football more seriously.<ref name="Pearce 1-2"/><ref name="Lyttleton">{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2010/soccer/world-cup-2010/writers/ben_lyttleton/07/04/forlan.suarez/ |first=Ben |last=Lyttleton |title=In Suarez's absence Uruguay will lean even more heavily on Forlan |work=SI.com |publisher=CNN |date=4 July 2010 |accessdate=21 August 2011}}</ref> In May 2005, at age 18, Suárez made his first-team debut against [[Junior de Barranquilla]] in the [[Copa Libertadores]].<ref name="Pearce 1-2"/> He scored his first goal in September 2005<ref name="personal bio">{{cite web|url=http://www.luissuarez.co.uk/en/biografia-en |first=Luis |last=Suarez |title=Biography – My History |publisher=Media Base Sports |accessdate=21 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110806120318/http://www.luissuarez.co.uk/en/biografia-en |archivedate=6 August 2011 |df= }}</ref> and helped Nacional win the [[2005–06 Uruguayan Primera División|2005–06 Uruguayan league]] with 10 goals in 27 matches.<ref name="football database">{{cite web |url=http://www.footballdatabase.eu/football.joueurs.luis.suarez.18685.en.html |title=Football: Luis Suárez |accessdate=31 January 2011 |publisher=FootballDatabase.eu}}</ref>
Suárez was found by a group of scouts from the Dutch club [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] when they were in Uruguay to scout another player. As they watched, he won and converted a penalty and scored a "wonder goal" against [[Defensor Sporting|Defensor]]. After watching only that match, the scouts approached Suárez and said they wanted to buy him, and after the season, Groningen paid Nacional €800,000 for him.<ref name="Pearce 1-2"/> Suárez was thrilled to go to Europe because his then girlfriend, and now wife, Sofía Balbi, had moved to [[Barcelona]]; they had maintained a long-distance relationship for a year and he wanted to move closer to her.<ref name="ESPNportrait"/><ref name="personal bio"/>
===Groningen=== [[File:Luis Suárez cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|Suárez on the training field of [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] in 2006]] Suárez was 19 years old when he joined Groningen. Initially, Suárez struggled because he could not speak Dutch or English, and he played on the second team to adjust to the Dutch game.<ref name="Pearce 1-3">{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-fc/lfc-player-profiles/luis-suarez/2011/02/09/luis-suarez-s-rise-from-the-streets-of-montevideo-to-liverpool-fc-hero-part-one-100252-28138725/3/ |first=James |last=Pearce |title=Luis Suarez's rise from the streets of Montevideo to Liverpool FC hero – part one |work=Liverpool Echo |publisher=Trinity Mirror |page=3 |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2011}}</ref> His teammate and fellow Uruguayan, [[Bruno Silva]], helped him settle into living in the Netherlands and playing for a new team.<ref name="Pearce 1-3"/> He worked hard to learn Dutch and his teammates respected him for his efforts with the language.<ref name="Pearce 1-3"/> Suárez scored goals for Groningen, but he also had disciplinary problems; in one five-game stretch in January 2007, he scored four goals but received three [[Yellow card (sports)|yellow cards]] and one [[Red card (sports)|red card]].<ref name="Lyttleton"/> Suárez especially made his mark in a 4–3 home win over [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]], when with ten minutes to go he subsequently won a penalty and scored two goals.<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=atY9rhyYhkw|title=FC Groningen Vitesse 2006|date=10 January 2013|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref> Suárez ended with 10 goals in 29 league appearances<ref name="Mathaba">{{cite news|url=http://mathaba.net/news/?x=560363 |title=Soccer: Ajax signs Uruguayan international Luis Suarez |publisher=Mathaba News Network |date=10 August 2007 |accessdate=22 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140827010120/http://mathaba.net/news/?x=560363 |archivedate=27 August 2014 |df= }}</ref> to help Groningen finish eighth in the [[2006–07 Eredivisie]].<ref name="Pearce 1-3"/><ref name="Mathaba"/> He also scored in a 4–2 loss<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2006/matches/round=2364/match=84903/postmatch/lineups/index.html |title=2006/07 UEFA Cup – History – Partizan-Groningen |work=UEFA.com |date=14 September 2006 |accessdate=22 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004215454/http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season%3D2006/matches/round%3D2364/match%3D84903/postmatch/lineups/index.html |archivedate=4 October 2013 |df= }}</ref> to Serbian club [[FK Partizan|Partizan]] in his European debut.<ref name="Pearce 1-3"/>
[[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] saw potential in Suárez and offered Groningen €3.5 million for him, but Groningen rejected the offer.<ref name="Pearce 1-4">{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-fc/lfc-player-profiles/luis-suarez/2011/02/09/luis-suarez-s-rise-from-the-streets-of-montevideo-to-liverpool-fc-hero-part-one-100252-28138725/4/ |first=James|last=Pearce |title=Luis Suarez's rise from the streets of Montevideo to Liverpool FC hero – part one |work=Liverpool Echo |publisher=Trinity Mirror |page=4 |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2011}}</ref> Suárez was upset and brought his case to the [[Royal Dutch Football Association]] (KNVB)'s arbitration committee to try to facilitate the sale.<ref name="Pearce 1-4"/> The arbitration committee ruled against him on 9 August 2007, but that same day, Ajax increased their offer to €7.5 million and Groningen accepted.<ref name="Mathaba"/><ref name="UEFA Ajax-Groningen">{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=569404.html |title=Ajax made to pay for Suárez |work=UEFA.com |publisher=UEFA |date=9 August 2007 |accessdate=21 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131228092519/http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid%3D569404.html |archivedate=28 December 2013 |df= }}</ref>
===Ajax=== ====2007–08 season==== Suárez signed a five-year contract with Ajax<ref name="Pearce 1-4"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/web/show/id=154814/contentid=63731 |title=Ajax sign Luis Suárez |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=9 August 2007 |accessdate=28 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407012838/http://english.ajax.nl/web/show/id%3D154814/contentid%3D63731 |archivedate= 7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> and made his club debut in the [[2007–08 UEFA Champions League qualifying rounds|UEFA Champions League qualifier]] against [[SK Slavia Prague|Slavia Prague]].<ref name="Ajax departure summary">{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-swaps-Ajax-for-Liverpool.htm |title=Suarez swaps Ajax for Liverpool |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110131191336/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-swaps-Ajax-for-Liverpool.htm |archivedate=31 January 2011 |df= }}</ref> He scored one goal in his Eredivisie debut for the club<ref name="Echo 2-1">{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/everton-fc/everton-fc-news/2011/02/10/the-luis-suarez-story-part-two-new-liverpool-fc-star-always-one-to-hit-the-headlines-100252-28146234/#ixzz1Vd3UyrWJ |title=The Luis Suarez story part two – new Liverpool FC star always one to hit the headlines |work=Liverpool Echo |date=10 February 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2011 |page=1 }}</ref> and two goals in his home debut at the [[Amsterdam Arena]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Match-photos-Ajax-sc-Heerenveen-41.htm |title=Match photos Ajax – sc Heerenveen (4–1) |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=26 August 2007 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407012856/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Match-photos-Ajax-sc-Heerenveen-41.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> Ajax finished second in league in the [[2007–08 Eredivisie|2007–08 season]]<ref>{{cite web |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/tables/_/league/ned.1/season/2007/dutch-eredivisie |title= 2007/08 Dutch Eredivisie Table / Standings |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |year= 2008 |accessdate=27 August 2011}}</ref> and Suárez scored 17 goals in 33 league appearances, setting up a blossoming striking partnership with league top scorer [[Klaas-Jan Huntelaar]].<ref name="Soccernet Ajax-Liv transfer">{{cite web |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/872253/liverpool-agree-fee-with-ajax-for-luis-suarez |title= Liverpool agree Suarez fee |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |date= 28 January 2011 |accessdate=28 August 2011}}</ref>
====2008–09 season==== During the [[2008–09 Eredivisie|2008–09 season]], Ajax head coach [[Marco van Basten]] noted how Suárez played an important role in many of Ajax's goals, but Van Basten was also upset by the number of yellow cards Suárez received.<ref name="Echo 2-1"/> Suárez was suspended for one match<ref>{{cite web |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/preview?id=249831 |title= Preview: ADO Den Haag v Ajax Amsterdam |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |date= 8 March 2009 |accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> because he was given his seventh yellow card of the season against [[FC Utrecht|Utrecht]] in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/249770 |title= Report: FC Utrecht v Ajax Amsterdam |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |date= 1 March 2009 |accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> He was also suspended after a half-time altercation with teammate [[Albert Luque]] over a [[Direct free kick|free kick]].<ref name="Lyttleton"/><ref name="Echo 2-1"/> Ajax ended the season in third place.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/tables/_/league/ned.1/season/2008/dutch-eredivisie |title= 2008/09 Dutch Eredivisie Table / Standings |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |year= 2009 |accessdate=27 August 2011}}</ref> Suárez scored 22 goals in 31 league matches<ref name="Echo 2-1"/><ref name="Soccernet Ajax-Liv transfer"/> and finished second in scoring tables, one goal behind [[Mounir El Hamdaoui]] of [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.footballdatabase.eu/football.competition.eredivisie.pays-bas.2008-2009..1065.en.html |title= Football – Competition: Eredivisie 2008/2009 – Rankings – Scorers |publisher=FootballDatabase.eu |accessdate=27 August 2011}}</ref> Suárez was also named Ajax Player of the Year.<ref name="Liverpool profile">{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.tv/team/first-team/player/7-luis-suarez |title=7. Luis Suárez Profile |publisher=Liverpool FC |work=LiverpoolFC.TV |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110828025502/http://www.liverpoolfc.tv/team/first-team/player/7-luis-suarez |archivedate=28 August 2011 |df= }}</ref>
====2009–10 season==== [[File:AFC Ajax 2010.jpg|thumb|left|Suárez (with the Ajax [[Pennant (sports)|pennant]]) as Ajax [[Captain (association football)|captain]] in 2010. Suárez was named captain in the 2009–10 season.]]
Before the [[2009–10 Eredivisie|2009–10 season]], [[Martin Jol]] replaced Van Basten as head coach.<ref name="Echo 2-1"/> After the departure of Ajax captain [[Thomas Vermaelen]] to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], Jol named Suárez team captain.<ref name="Echo 2-2"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Luis-Suarez-named-Ajaxs-captain.htm |title=Luis Suarez named Ajax's captain |publisher=Ajax.nl |date=15 July 2009 |accessdate=26 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407012902/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Luis-Suarez-named-Ajaxs-captain.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> Suárez started scoring goals early in the season with a hat-trick in a 4–1 win against [[RKC Waalwijk]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/match/_/id/271719 |title= Match: Ajax Amsterdam v RKC Waalwijk |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |date= 8 August 2009 |accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> He had a number of multiple-goal matches throughout the season, including four in wins over [[ŠK Slovan Bratislava|Slovan Bratislava]] in the [[UEFA Europa League 2009–10 play-off round|UEFA Europe League play-off round]],<ref>{{cite news |url= http://en.mercopress.com/2009/08/21/sensational-suarez-hits-four-for-ayax |title= Sensational Suarez hits four for Ayax |first= Patrick|last=Watts |agency= MercoPress |date= 21 August 2009 |accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> [[VVV-Venlo]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=678051&sec=europe |title=Eredivisie: Suarez bags four as Ajax thrash VVV |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=20 September 2009 |accessdate=13 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-strikes-at-the-right-time.htm |title=Suarez strikes at the right time |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=20 September 2009 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013116/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-strikes-at-the-right-time.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> and [[Roda JC Kerkrade|Roda JC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-lifts-Ajax-over-Roda.htm |title=Suarez lifts Ajax over Roda |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=4 February 2010 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013133/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-lifts-Ajax-over-Roda.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> He scored three in the first half in another win over VVV-Venlo<ref>{{cite news |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/271804 |title= Report: Ajax Amsterdam v VVV Venlo |publisher= ESPN Soccernet |date= 11 April 2010 |accessdate=26 August 2011}}</ref> and six against [[WHC Wezep]] in the [[KNVB Cup]] as Ajax won by a club-record margin of 14–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-reaches-Cup-quarterfinal-with-record-win.htm |title=Ajax reaches Cup quarterfinal with record win |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=23 December 2009 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407012725/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-reaches-Cup-quarterfinal-with-record-win.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref>
Suárez scored two goals in the [[Two-legged tie|second leg]] of the KNVB Cup final and finished as the tournament's top scorer.<ref name="Ajax wins Cup">{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-wins-Cup.htm |title=Ajax wins Cup |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=6 May 2010 |accessdate=27 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013139/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-wins-Cup.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> Ajax won the Cup final 6–1 on [[Aggregate score#Total points series (aggregate)|aggregate]] over [[Feyenoord]],<ref name="Liverpool profile"/><ref name="Ajax wins Cup"/><ref name="Echo 2-3">{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/everton-fc/everton-fc-news/2011/02/10/the-luis-suarez-story-part-two-new-liverpool-fc-star-always-one-to-hit-the-headlines-100252-28146234/3/ |title=The Luis Suarez story part two – new Liverpool FC star always one to hit the headlines |work=Liverpool Echo|publisher=Trinity Mirror |date=10 February 2011 |accessdate=23 August 2011 |page=3 }}</ref> but they finished second in the league behind [[FC Twente|Twente]].<ref name="Echo 2-2">{{cite news |url= http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/everton-fc/everton-fc-news/2011/02/10/the-luis-suarez-story-part-two-new-liverpool-fc-star-always-one-to-hit-the-headlines-100252-28146234/2/ |title=The Luis Suarez story part two – new Liverpool FC star always one to hit the headlines |work=Liverpool Echo|publisher=Trinity Mirror |date=10 February 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2011 |page=2 }}</ref>
Suárez ended the season as the Eredivisie's top scorer with 35 goals in 33 matches<ref name="Soccernet Ajax-Liv transfer"/><ref name="Echo 2-2"/> and had 49 goals in all competitions.<ref name="Echo 2-2"/> He was named Ajax Player of the Year for the second straight year<ref name="Liverpool profile"/> and [[Dutch Footballer of the Year]].<ref name="Liverpool profile"/><ref name="Echo 2-2"/><ref>{{cite web|first=Johannes |last=Baas |url=http://www.elsevier.nl/web/Nieuws/Sport/264665/Luis-Suarez-beste-eredivisievoetballer-van-het-jaar.htm |title=Luis Suarez beste eredivisievoetballer van het jaar |publisher=Elsevier |date=3 May 2010 |accessdate=3 May 2010 |language=Dutch |trans-title=Luis Suarez Eredivisie player of the year |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724152720/http://www.elsevier.nl/web/Nieuws/Sport/264665/Luis-Suarez-beste-eredivisievoetballer-van-het-jaar.htm |archivedate=24 July 2011 |df= }}</ref>
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Suarez Ajax captain.jpg|thumb|Suárez playing for Ajax in a [[UEFA Champions League]] match against [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]] in 2010]]
Soon after Suárez returned from his World Cup campaign, he scored his 100th goal for Ajax in a 1–1 home draw against [[PAOK FC|PAOK]] in a [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League#Third qualifying round|UEFA Champions League qualifier]].<ref name="Liverpool profile"/><ref name="Ajax100">{{cite web|url=http://www.vi.nl/Nieuws-item/184459/Suarez-veertiende-Ajacied-met-minimaal-honderd-goals.htm |title=Suarez veertiende Ajacied met minimaal honderd goals |publisher=Voetbal International |date=28 July 2010 |accessdate=6 August 2010 |language=Dutch |trans-title=Suarez Ajax's fourteenth player with at least one hundred goals |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100731085836/http://www.vi.nl/Nieuws-item/184459/Suarez-veertiende-Ajacied-met-minimaal-honderd-goals.htm |archivedate=31 July 2010 }}</ref> This put him in an elite group of players, including [[Johan Cruyff]], Marco van Basten and [[Dennis Bergkamp]], to score 100 or more goals with the club.<ref name="Echo 2-3"/><ref name="Ajax100"/> Suárez continued his scoring run with a hat-trick against [[De Graafschap]] in a 5–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-hat-trick-helps-Ajax-win.htm |title=Suarez' hat trick helps Ajax win |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=29 August 2010 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013145/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Suarez-hat-trick-helps-Ajax-win.htm |archivedate=7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref>
=====First biting incident===== On 20 November 2010, Suárez bit [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]]'s [[Otman Bakkal]] on the shoulder during a 0–0 draw. Ajax suspended him for two matches and fined him an undisclosed amount, which the club said they would donate to a "good cause".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-accepts-Suarez-suspension.htm |title=Ajax accepts Suarez' suspension |work=Ajax.nl |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=24 November 2010 |accessdate=25 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407013208/http://english.ajax.nl/News/Archive/Article/Ajax-accepts-Suarez-suspension.htm |archivedate= 7 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> The Dutch daily newspaper ''[[De Telegraaf]]'' branded Suárez the "Cannibal of Ajax".<ref name="Cannibal of Ajax"/><ref name="Echo 2-3"/> The KNVB increased Suárez's suspension to seven league matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1340434.html |title=Suarez banned for seven games |agency= Press Association |work=FIFA.com |date=24 November 2010 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> Suárez apologised for his actions through a video he uploaded to his [[Facebook]] page.<ref name="Echo 2-3"/>
=====Transfer to Liverpool===== During the suspension, Ajax were in contact with other European clubs interested in Suárez.
